intro: Koanophyllon polyodon, commonly known as the hairyleaf bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and adapted growth habits. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Koanophyllon polyodon is often found in chaparral and scrub habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native regions.
